ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: A collection of tools that support data diagnosis, exploration, and transformation. Data diagnostics provides information and visualization of missing values and outliers and unique and negative values to help you understand the distribution and quality of your data. Data exploration provides information and visualization of the descriptive statistics of univariate variables, normality tests and outliers, correlation of two variables, and relationship between target variable and predictor. Data transformation supports binning for categorizing continuous variables, imputates missing values and outliers, resolving skewness. And it creates automated reports that support these three tasks.

A collection of tools that support data diagnosis, exploration, and transformation. Data diagnostics provides information and visualization of missing values and outliers and unique and negative values to help you understand the distribution and quality of your data. Data exploration provides information and visualization of the descriptive statistics of univariate variables, normality tests and outliers, correlation of two variables, and relationship between target variable and predictor. Data transformation supports binning for categorizing continuous variables, imputates missing values and outliers, resolving skewness. And it creates automated reports that support these three tasks.

name: r-dlookr
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "0.6.5" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-dlookr
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/dlookr_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/dlookr/dlookr_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 122641058c3cc651efc9c03f42cf342696d1616dfcac00b27ba49936910db770

build:
  number: 1
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-dplyr >=0.7.6
    - r-ggplot2 >=3.0.0
    - r-gridextra
    - r-hrbrthemes >=0.8.0
    - r-htmltools
    - r-kableextra
    - r-knitr >=1.22
    - r-mice
    - r-pagedown >=0.15
    - r-partykit
    - r-purrr
    - r-reactable
    - r-rlang
    - r-rmarkdown
    - r-rpart
    - r-shiny
    - r-showtext >=0.9_4
    - r-sysfonts >=0.7.1
    - r-tibble
    - r-tidyr
    - r-tidyselect
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-dplyr >=0.7.6
    - r-ggplot2 >=3.0.0
    - r-gridextra
    - r-hrbrthemes >=0.8.0
    - r-htmltools
    - r-kableextra
    - r-knitr >=1.22
    - r-mice
    - r-pagedown >=0.15
    - r-partykit
    - r-purrr
    - r-reactable
    - r-rlang
    - r-rmarkdown
    - r-rpart
    - r-shiny
    - r-showtext >=0.9_4
    - r-sysfonts >=0.7.1
    - r-tibble
    - r-tidyr
    - r-tidyselect

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('dlookr')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('dlookr')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://choonghyunryu.github.io/dlookr/
  dev_url: https://github.com/choonghyunryu/dlookr/
  license: GPL-2.0-only
  summary: A collection of tools that support data diagnosis, exploration, and transformation. Data diagnostics provides information and visualization of missing values and outliers and unique and negative values to help you understand the distribution and quality of your data. Data exploration provides information and visualization
    of the descriptive statistics of univariate variables, normality tests and outliers, correlation of two variables, and relationship between target variable and predictor. Data transformation supports binning for categorizing continuous variables, imputates missing values and outliers, resolving skewness. And it creates
    automated reports that support these three tasks.
  license_family: GPL2
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-2

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
